intro: Orphanidesia gaultherioides, commonly known as the dwarf snowbell, is a low-growing shrub native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant features small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring, often covered in a fine, silvery down. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with a dense layer of short hairs. Orphanidesia gaultherioides thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
